docs.title: Cybercraft 5e
docs.text:
Welcome to Cybercraft 5e, a cyberpunk-eldritch setting for the 5e rules system.

Here you'll find everything you need to create characters, run games, and explore the neon-lit, shadow-infested streets of Echolight City.

docs.title: Anomalies & The Veil
docs.text: Anomalies are rifts or disturbances caused by the Veil’s influence.

docs.title: Types
docs.text:
• Spatial Distortions — warped geometry and impossible angles.
  • Temporal Echoes — time loops or sudden time loss.
  • Entity Manifestations — appearance of hostile or neutral beings.

docs.title: Rules
docs.text:
• Proximity requires Sanity checks.
  • Long exposure can cause mutations or corruption.

docs.title: Bestiary
docs.text: Sample enemies for Cybercraft campaigns.

docs.title: Veilspawn
docs.text: Twisted creatures from beyond reality.

docs.title: Techno-Liches
docs.text: Hackers who uploaded themselves into cursed networks.

docs.title: Shadow Constructs
docs.text:
Animated machines powered by eldritch cores.

Full stat blocks can be built using standard 5e monster creation guidelines.

docs.title: Corporate Towers
docs.text: High-security, high-tech spires housing executives and labs.

docs.title: Street Sectors
docs.text: Markets, gangs, and independent operators.

docs.title: Veil Zones
docs.text: Quarantined districts riddled with anomalies and unstable reality.

docs.title: Outskirts
docs.text: Shanty towns, industrial ruins, and black-market ports.

docs.title: Factions
docs.text: Factions control resources, run black markets, and wage shadow wars.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• HelixCorp — biotech conglomerate.
  • Black Spire Syndicate — occult cartel.
  • Veilguard — hunters of anomalies.
  • Ghost Circuit — anarchist hacker collective.

Faction reputation can grant: - Discounts on gear - Access to restricted areas - Unique missions

docs.title: Running Cybercraft
docs.text: Cybercraft campaigns combine cyberpunk intrigue with cosmic horror. The tone should balance high-tech grit with otherworldly dread.

docs.title: Themes
docs.text:
• The fragility of humanity in the face of rapid evolution.
  • The corrupting influence of power — technological or eldritch.
  • The thin barrier between reality and the Veil.

docs.title: GM Tips
docs.text:
• Use faction politics to drive player choices.
  • Mix digital and physical threats.
  • Reward creativity with tech-magic combinations.

docs.title: Setting Overview
docs.text: Cybercraft is set in Echolight City, a sprawling megacity built atop ancient ruins where the Veil between worlds runs thin.

docs.title: Key Facts
docs.text:
• The city is divided into Corporate Towers, Street Sectors, and Veil Zones.
  • The Veil is a metaphysical boundary that leaks eldritch energy into reality.
  • Mega-factions control resources, information, and entire districts.

docs.title: Tone
docs.text: Think Blade Runner meets Hellraiser with a dash of Shadowrun.

docs.title: Backgrounds
docs.text: Cybercraft backgrounds combine personal history with faction influence.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• Corporate Operative
  • Street Rat
  • Void Scholar
  • Ex-Military
  • Cult Initiate

docs.title: Classes
docs.text:
Cybercraft offers six core classes, each with unique flavor and mechanics.

  • Scriptweaver
  • Voidrunner
  • Warjack
  • Veilbreaker
  • Ghostlink
  • Fleshshaper

docs.title: Feats
docs.text:
Cybercraft introduces feats to enhance technological and eldritch abilities.

  • Cybernetic Specialist
  • Void Adept
  • Urban Predator
  • Neon Reflexes

docs.title: Gear & Items
docs.text: Items are divided into tiers: - Tier 0: Civilian - Tier 1: Street - Tier 2: Military - Tier 3: Experimental - Tier 4: Eldritch-Tech - Tier 5: Legendary

docs.title: Categories
docs.text:
• Weapons
  • Armor
  • Cybernetic Implants
  • Eldritch Relics
  • Hybrid Tech

docs.title: Races
docs.text:
Cybercraft features five core playable races, each adapted to survive in the neon-lit, shadow-infested streets of Echolight City and beyond.

  • Humans
  • Synthetics
  • Vampyrus
  • Anomalie
  • Umbraliths

docs.title: Fleshshaper
docs.text: Biomancers who twist organic matter to heal or harm.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d8
  • Primary Abilities: Constitution, Wisdom
  • Saves: Constitution, Wisdom

docs.title: Ghostlink
docs.text: Digital infiltrators who move between physical and virtual worlds.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d8
  • Primary Abilities: Intelligence, Dexterity
  • Saves: Intelligence, Dexterity

docs.title: Scriptweaver
docs.text: Masters of technotheurgy, blending code and magic.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d8
  • Primary Abilities: Intelligence, Dexterity
  • Saves: Intelligence, Wisdom
  • Armor: Light
  • Weapons: Simple

docs.title: Level 1
docs.text:
• Code Rites
  • Technotheurgic Tools
  • Arcane Interface

docs.title: Subclasses
docs.text:
• Codebound
  • Augmenter
  • Veilpiercer

docs.title: Veilbreaker
docs.text: Hunters of the unnatural, wielding weapons and wards against the Veil.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d8
  • Primary Abilities: Wisdom, Constitution
  • Saves: Wisdom, Strength

docs.title: Voidrunner
docs.text: Explorers and smugglers who navigate the hidden pathways of the Veil.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d8
  • Primary Abilities: Dexterity, Wisdom
  • Saves: Dexterity, Wisdom
  • Armor: Light, Medium
  • Weapons: Simple, Martial

docs.title: Warjack
docs.text: Cybernetic warriors built for urban and battlefield dominance.

docs.title: Class Features
docs.text:
• Hit Die: d10
  • Primary Abilities: Strength, Constitution
  • Saves: Strength, Constitution
  • Armor: All armor
  • Weapons: Simple, Martial

docs.title: Anomalie
docs.text: Humanoids warped by the Veil — part mortal, part eldritch.

docs.title: Traits
docs.text:
• ASI: Wis +2, choice of Con or Int +1.
  • Size: Medium.
  • Speed: 30 ft.
  • Veil Sense: Detect nearby anomalies within 30 ft.
  • Warped Resilience: Advantage on saves vs madness or corruption.

docs.title: Mutations
docs.text: Choose one: - Eldritch Gaze: Thaumaturgy cantrip. - Tentacle Limb: Natural attack, 1d6 bludgeoning. - Phasing Flesh: Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) in dim light.

docs.title: Humans
docs.text: Humans in Letheris are adaptable survivors. Their ability to rapidly evolve culturally and technologically has allowed them to thrive in all environments.

docs.title: Traits
docs.text:
• Ability Score Increase: Increase each ability score by 1.
  • Age: Adulthood in late teens; rarely live past a century.
  • Size: Medium.
  • Speed: 30 ft.
  • Adaptable Talent: Gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.
  • Versatile Feat: Gain one feat of your choice.

docs.title: Templates
docs.text:
Voidtouched - ASI: Con +2, Int +1 - Powers: You know thaumaturgy. At 3rd level, cast arms of hadar 1/day.

Augmented - ASI: Con +2, Str or Dex +1 - Features: Advantage vs poison, resistance to poison damage.

Mutated - ASI: Con +2, Wis +1 - Features: Darkvision 60 ft., one environmental adaptation.

Psyker - ASI: Int +2, Cha +1 - Powers: You know mage hand. At 3rd level, cast detect thoughts 1/day.

Bioengineered - ASI: Str, Dex, or Int +2, Con +1 - Features: Advantage vs disease, require only 4 hours sleep for a long rest.

docs.title: Synthetics
docs.text: Artificial beings created from metal, circuits, or nanostructures.

docs.title: Traits
docs.text:
• ASI: Int +2, choice of Str or Dex +1.
  • Size: Medium.
  • Speed: 30 ft.
  • Constructed Body: Immune to disease, do not need to eat or breathe.
  • Self-Repair: Spend 1 hit die to repair during a short rest.

docs.title: Subtypes
docs.text:
Mechanoid - Advantage on Strength checks involving lifting or carrying.

Nanomorph - Can alter appearance within humanoid parameters (Disguise Kit proficiency).

Neuroframe - Advantage on saves vs being charmed or frightened.

docs.title: Umbraliths
docs.text: Sentient shadows born from the depths of the Veil.

docs.title: Traits
docs.text:
• ASI: Dex +2, choice of Cha or Wis +1.
  • Size: Medium.
  • Speed: 30 ft.
  • Shadowmeld: Advantage on Stealth in darkness.
  • Light Vulnerability: Disadvantage on attack rolls in bright light.
  • Ethereal Step: Bonus action to teleport 10 ft. to a shadowed space.

docs.title: Vampyrus
docs.text: Cursed beings blending flesh, shadow, and hunger.

docs.title: Traits
docs.text:
• ASI: Cha +2, choice of Dex or Con +1.
  • Size: Medium.
  • Speed: 30 ft.
  • Darkvision: 60 ft.
  • Blood Hunger: Once per long rest, you may regain HP equal to your level by feeding on a living creature.
  • Sunlight Sensitivity: Disadvantage on attack rolls and Perception in direct sunlight.

docs.title: Bloodlines
docs.text:
Daywalker - Reduced sunlight penalties, gain advantage on one saving throw type.

Nightborn - Stealth proficiency, advantage on hiding in dim light or darkness.

Voidspawn - Can cast arms of hadar once per long rest.

docs.text:

docs.title: Conditions
docs.text:
• Glitched — cybernetic/magic systems impaired.
  • Corrupted — affected by Veil energy.

docs.title: Common Rolls
docs.text:
• Hacking Attempt: Intelligence (Technology)
  • Eldritch Analysis: Intelligence (Arcana)
  • Streetwise Info: Charisma (Investigation or Persuasion)

docs.title: Combat
docs.text: Combat in Cybercraft follows 5e rules with added layers for ranged firearms, cybernetic abilities, and hybrid weapons.

docs.title: Firearms
docs.text:
• Light Firearms: 1d6 damage, light property.
  • Heavy Firearms: 2d6 damage, two-handed property.
  • Reload: Some weapons require the reload property to be managed.

docs.title: Cover & Environments
docs.text:
• Urban combat often uses half, three-quarters, and full cover.
  • Dim lighting and neon haze can impose disadvantage on Perception.

docs.title: Tech & Magic Interference
docs.text: If a cybernetic device or magical item is disrupted, the user may need to pass a Constitution saving throw (DC varies) to keep it functional.

docs.title: Core Rules
docs.text: Cybercraft 5e is fully compatible with the 5e System Reference Document (SRD 5.1), with additional rules for technology, eldritch effects, and the fusion of both.

docs.title: Rule Additions
docs.text:
• Cybernetic Augments: Special implants and modifications that grant unique abilities.
  • Corruption & Sanity: Tracking the toll of exposure to the Veil and eldritch horrors.
  • Faction Influence: Your standing with powerful groups can unlock gear, allies, and missions.
  • Tech-Eldritch Interaction: Rules for how magic and cybernetics can disrupt or enhance each other.

docs.title: Economy & Currency
docs.text: Cybercraft uses three main currencies: - Creds: Standard electronic currency. - Chits: Physical tokens for street-level trade. - Artefacts: Eldritch relics used in high-value black-market exchanges.

docs.title: Gear Tiers
docs.text: Items are categorized from Tier 0 (Civilian) to Tier 5 (Legendary Myth-Tech). See Gear & Items for details.

docs.title: Sanity & Corruption
docs.text: The Veil is a thin boundary between reality and eldritch chaos. Exposure can warp the mind and soul.

docs.title: Sanity Checks
docs.text: When encountering an eldritch anomaly or horrifying event, make a Sanity saving throw (Wisdom or Charisma).

docs.title: Corruption
docs.text:
• Gain corruption points when using certain Void-based abilities or artifacts.
  • At 5, 10, and 15 corruption points, gain a mutation or psychological scar.
  • At 20 corruption points, the character is lost to the Void.

docs.title: Skills & Checks
docs.text: Cybercraft uses the standard 5e skill list with new skill applications and special cases for a cyberpunk-eldritch world.

docs.title: Additional Skill Uses
docs.text:
• Arcana: Identify eldritch anomalies or technomagic effects.
  • Investigation: Trace network intrusions or decode corrupted data.
  • Technology (new skill): Repair, modify, or disable technological devices.
  • Deception: Fool biometric scanners, spoof IDs, or hide network presence.
